attributes.action: Pay volunteer carers the national minimum wage with full employment rights.
attributes.background:
Official figures have estimated that unpaid carers save the government £162 bn per yr. The cost of a local authority providing the same level of in home care is avrg £17.20 per hr.
The threshold for someone claiming carers allowance is a min of 35hrs per week @ £62,10 that is £1.77p per hr !
attributes.additional_details: Many carers have to give up jobs and careers in order to do a job that the local authority should be doing and get little or no thanks and support. Full time carers should be at least entitled to the minimum wage and statutory holidays with replacement care provided by local authorities. Anything less than this is just slave labour with the government taking unfair advantage of an unrecognized, unapreciated and valuable work force that, last year, paid for the NHS budget

attributes.action: Make it law that all vehicles have to be fitted with a lifehammer.
attributes.background: After hearing the awful tragedy of the family who lost their lives as their car went off the pier in Buncrana, it stresses the importance a lifehammer or emergency hammer could have on saving lives. They cost barely anything. They break the glass windows in emergencies allowing people to escape.
attributes.additional_details: Many vehicles already have life hammers fitted Including Buses and plant machinery. But cars do not. Lifehammers or emergency hammers could save lives. Car window glass is almost impossible to break with just human force alone, especially when you only have a limited time to do it. So please help to make having a lifehammer or emergency hammer in your vehicle a law. It really could save lives.

attributes.action: Bring back the Emerging Personality Disorder Unit in Somerset Areas
attributes.background:
The Emerging Personality Disorder team help many young adults who are diagnosed with Emerging Personality Disorders.
 A Personality Disorder is a type of mental illness that affects a persons behaviours and thoughts.
 The team in Somerset and surrounding areas has been cut.
attributes.additional_details: This team is key to many young adults recovery.

attributes.action: Stop undue Government interference in Local Government Pension Fund investment.
attributes.background:
Pension fund regulation should ensure responsible investment decisions to pay pension benefits. 
The Government are proposing to direct investment policies of Local Government Pension Funds, surpassing Uk pension fund Investment Regulations.This may not be in the best interest of scheme members.
attributes.additional_details:
References
Paper by the Department for Communities and Local Government entitled Investment Reform Criteria and Guidance. November 2015

attributes.action: Campaign to keep the Mersey bridges toll free.
attributes.background:
In autumn 2017 a new six-lane bridge over the Mersey between Runcorn and Widnes will open to assist the neighbouring Silver Jubilee Bridge.

Both the new Mersey Gateway Bridge and the historically free existing Jubilee Bridge will be heavily tolled.
attributes.additional_details:
The tolls are unfair and will penalise workers, residents, businesses and visitors as well as create a new "North - South Divide". It will also be an unwanted "City Tax" on Liverpool for visitors and tourists.

Businesses who operate vehicles (like taxi's, minibuses, PSV, LGV and HGV operators) who need to cross the Mersey for their normal course of duty (often many times per day) will be financially discriminated against and secure an unfair competitive advantage to others through no fault of their own.

WE MUST STAND UP FOR WHAT IS RIGHT AND FAIR TO ALL AND FIGHT AGAINST THESE TOLLS!

attributes.action: The EU flag be flown from parliament on alternate days with the Union Flag.
attributes.background: This petition grows out of national frustration with the referendum, and at how various governments, over the decades, have failed to promote the benefits of the EU to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details:
Flags are matters of high symbolic importance. In most EU member states, the EU flag is routinely flown alongside the national flag. This practice should have been instituted in the UK long ago. 
The most prominent flagstaff in the land is that on Parliament itself. For practical reasons it may not be possible to hoist two, thus the proposal is for flying the UK and EU flags on alternate days.

attributes.action: Work permit for Indian restaurant skilled staff crisis
attributes.background: The Indian restaurant trade is dying due to lack of staff we need the government to help us bring skilled staff to restaurant trade to survive. Look at introducing work permits again
attributes.additional_details: Limit the amount of work permit per restaurant to limit abuse

attributes.action: Reintroduce the death penalty once the UK leaves the European Union.
attributes.background: Once UK leaves the European Union, we do petition Her Majesty's Government to repeal the Human Rights Act and withdraw from any treaties necessary to permit capital punishment to be reintroduced as a punishment against particularly abhorrent crimes such as murder and certain sexual crimes.

attributes.action: Instate the death penalty for all paedophiles.
attributes.background: The European Convention of Human Rights has interfered with the rights of British children to be protected from the most depraved individuals infesting our society. The death penalty should be instated against all pedophiles, as the ultimate deterrent and the ultimate protection for our children.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophilia, parallels genocide as one of the most vile acts committed against the most vulnerable. It is our duty to protect children from all levels of harm. The present legal system of a few years to life in prison for pedophiles, fails completely to protect children. The soft penalty of prison, does nothing to deter offenders and entices paedophiles released from prison to offend again, and again and again. Hanging paedophiles will make them think twice before harming children.

attributes.action: No action to leave the EU until Parliament has approved  alternative policy
attributes.background: No detailed alternative policy on relations with EU was set out in referendum. Our elected representatives should approve one as a basis for negotiation with the EU before Article 50 or other measures are initiated to trigger departure

attributes.action: Make government responses to petitions more productive.
attributes.background: The responses to petitions started online more often than not simply sustain that "the government is confident it has made the right decision." This is hugely counter-productive in easing the public's concerns over government actions.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that a petition gains the appropriate number of signatures to be responded to, it is clear that a large number of people disagree that the government has made the right decision, and reiterating this statement without any due consideration for why or where the concerns are coming from defeats the object of having this platform for petitions. 
Concerns must be understood and responded to with possible courses of action to improve the situation brought to attention by the petitions.

attributes.action: make it  compulsory  to  neuter  after  1st litter  in dogs
attributes.background: please   help   these  rescue    reduce   being overun     by  making it  legal  all  owners  spay  after  first  litter
attributes.additional_details: we   the public  would  love  to  see a law    , that all  breeders   are  made  to  neuter  dogs  after  1st  litter  ,  and a law against  any breeder  cross breeding pedigree  dogs    ,  rescues  over  run  already and lots being  pts  as cant  be rehomed  , these   owners cross  breeding  for   cockapoo  etc  are adding  to  it

attributes.action: To make it it illegal to out LGBT people without their permission
attributes.background: As many sites are outing members of LGBT youths and adults without there permission and this can cause victims to get abuse and have problems at home.

attributes.action: David Cameron to apologise over his irrelevant comments towards Jeremy Corbyn
attributes.background: For too long David Cameron and his backbenchers have used their time in the house of commons avoiding questions, and slandering Jeremy Corbyn's appearance and rudely speaking and jeering over a man the majority of labour supports elected into power.

attributes.action: Re-instate Hard Shoulders on ALL Motorways and Scrap the Smart Motorway
attributes.background: The removal of the Hard Shoulder has made it more dangerous to all users of the motorway. It is not possible to get to the next refuge if the car has lost power. At night or in fog there is no possibility to warn others following of the danger & recovering a vehicle is now more dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Tuesday 11 December 1984: A serious multiple Road Traffic Accident on the M25 near Clacket Lane, Kent; nine people were killed and ten injured.
One of the worst multiple vehicle accidents happened on the M25, where the hard shoulder has now been removed. Twenty-six vehicles and thirty one drivers and passengers were involved. The accident happened in dense fog, which seemed to have descended suddenly and nine people died in the subsequent accident.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in England on maintaining the ban on hunting foxes with hounds
attributes.background: The hunting of foxes is a controversial issue which should be decided by the whole electorate. This petition calls upon HM Government to hold a referendum in England to establish whether or not the English electorate believes that the ban on hunting foxes with hounds should be upheld and maintained.

attributes.action: Make reporting driver details in a road traffic accident mandatory
attributes.background:
We must make the offence of failing or refusing to report the driver details of a vehicle involved in a road traffic accident to be at least equal to the offence committed in the accident itself. 
Currently if refused, they are given penalty points and a small fine. This is woefully inadequate.
attributes.additional_details:
With respect to this RTA where a cyclist was seriously injured in a hit and run accident:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-nottinghamshire-35472617
To protect road users, failure to respond with full driver details on demand should be deemed as:
* Contempt
* Admission of guilt by all parties that fail to respond
This is a serious loophole which has been exploited to allow the person responsible for a serious road traffic accident to escape the correct punishment and is free to repeat again.

attributes.action: Permit a one off national holiday celebrating immigrants and their contributions
attributes.background: In light of recent doubts raised across multiple spectrums about the benefits of immigration we believe it is time for immigrants to reveal their true value the country. By staging a single one off strike/national holiday the impact of the U.K. without immigrants might be better understood.

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to report on the accuracy of MPs' public statements.
attributes.background: The EU referendum highlighted the damage that can be caused by false & misleading information. We the undersigned propose that an independent panel should be established to report to the public on the validity and accuracy of MPs' public comments.
attributes.additional_details: At the heart of democracy is clear information sharing & communication. MPs should therefore be held to account for the validity of information they share. We advise that the Independent Panel will assess MPs' comments upon request from the public. Each comment could be assessed as to whether it is factually correct/incorrect, verifiable/unverifiable, or misleadingly presented. There could be sanctions for repeat offenders of misleading information & an 'honesty' league table of MPs.

attributes.action: Ban politicians from office who lie or deliberately/knowingly deceive the public
attributes.background: Recently there has been considerable deception on the part of politicians who appear to have deliberately deceived the British public on matters affecting the future well-being of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: A politician shown to have seriously lied or deliberately or knowingly deceived the public on important matters of national interest should be barred from holding any ministerial post in government.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to Trigger Article 50 and repeal EC Act 1972.
attributes.background: We live in a Democracy and the EU Referendum result should be honoured by the Government.  Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty must be triggered and the European Communities Act 1972 should be repealed.

attributes.action:
If the UK votes leave and London votes IN,
London should become Independent.
attributes.background: Polls suggest that London will vote in favour of remaining in the EU. Scotland is already planning to leave Great Britain in order to remain in the EU, if Britain votes to leave. London should have the opportunity to do the same. Its population is larger than many EU states.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/eu-referendum-london-backs-remain-vote-poll-shows-a3256001.html

attributes.action: Include Feminism as part of the primary and/or secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: As a female sixth form student, I have come across few male peers who fully understand feminism. Many refuse to accept that gender inequality is still an issue both nationally and globally, and see feminists as man-hating groups advocating female superiority. This ignorance must be addressed.
attributes.additional_details: If people were made aware and given a full understanding of Feminism and gender inequality from a young age, they would be far more tuned in to these issues in adult life. This would be effective in helping society to become more equal and tolerant in terms of gender, which would benefit everyone, including men. The main factor inhibiting the achievement of gender equality appears to be a general ignorance of the fact that inequality exists. The way to address this ignorance is education.

attributes.action: Change Election Law to Require Full Disclosure of Funding
attributes.background: The OECD, the LSE, and many others have declared their support for remaining in the EU, but the public may not be aware that many of these organisations receive funding from the EU, potentially creating a conflict of interest.  The law should be changed to make voters aware of potential conflicts.
attributes.additional_details:
The OECD, the LSE, and a number of unions have declared their support for remaining in the EU, but the public may not be aware that these organisations receive funding from the EU, potentially creating a conflict of interest.
To avoid this in future, the government should change the law on elections.  Organisations endorsing an institution in a public vote should be required to disclose whether they've received funding from that institution and how much they've had in the preceding 3 years.

attributes.action: Stop lobbying by means of political donation
attributes.background: It is about time that political lobbying is made both clearer and less open to abuse. Let's fund political parties out of public money only and end the opportunity for political lobbying via donations. Take lobbying by means of political donation out of the equation and there'd be a lot less sleaze.
attributes.additional_details: All political parties should be funded via a mechanism similar to short money which should be shared equally to all political parties that achieve a minimum number of members who agree to follow the Electoral Commission rules.

attributes.action: National Lottery money should stay in the UK and be Not For Profit
attributes.background:
The National Lottery should be owned and regulated by the government or a Not for Profit company not owned by a Canadian company 

please read, copy and paste the link, please take this seriously...

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/where-does-surplus-profit-go-nigel-gregory?trk=mp-author-card
attributes.additional_details:
The National Lottery should be owned and regulated by the government or a Not for Profit company regulated by the government and all surplus income should go to charitable causes in the UK. 

At the moment the ultimate owner is a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund who are receiving millions in shareholders funds paid for by people in the UK 

copy and paste the link, please take this seriously...

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/where-does-surplus-profit-go-nigel-gregory?trk=mp-author-card

attributes.action: Consider having judge & jury in family courts for adoption matters.
attributes.background: Through personal experience I feel strongly that family courts when dealing with adoption cases should be judge & jury. The reason being that in some genuine cases such as mine where someone without very little family support often get's unheard and treated unfairly.

attributes.action: Cancel plans for a new "Death Tax".  Probate should be the same for all.
attributes.background: The work that the Probate Registry does is the same whatever the value of the estate. There is no excuse to introduce this extortionate, banded tax. Taxing already-taxed money is offensive enough. The Conservative manifesto promised to decrease Inheritance Tax, NOT raise it through a back door.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of money it is planned to raise through this tax is a relative pittance to the UK Government, but to individuals, it will be a fortune to the bereaved and the executors. 

Even IHT is one of the UK's least efficient taxes.  

If the government cannot balance the budget, the Chancellor must start collecting the billions hidden by large multi-national corporations, and not making some side agreement with these CFOs via a dodgy handshake.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as P.M
attributes.background: Theresa May has had a one house race to become prime minister without anyone voting for her outside of parliament. Therefor a General Election should be called within 1 year.

attributes.action: Qualify MA (LPC with Business) for Postgraduate Student Finance funding.
attributes.background: Student Finance has recently announced that from 1 August 2016 it will be possible to apply for up to £10,000 funding to pay for the course and the living expenses.  Currently this does not include the Legal Practice Course with integrated  Masters.
attributes.additional_details: Students who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves do have the opportunity to complete their Legal Practice course. If Student Finance is available for Masters, then it should also be available for the other postgraduate courses which include Masters qualification.

attributes.action: Only one councillor should represent a ward in the local councils.
attributes.background: Derbyshire PCC Mr Hardayal Dhindsa is a local councillor as well. PCC role is quite demanding and a full time position, still Mr Dhindsa decided to continue as a Councillor. This shows that three councillors aren't needed to represent a ward specially when in Sandwell 71 out of 72 are from Labour.
attributes.additional_details: In Derby there are total of 17 wards and every ward has 3 councillors. Interestingly if all three are from the same party then it becomes quite pointless to have them. There is no job description and position doesn't have any accountability. One tory councillor kept on getting paid while he lived abroad. Also councils like Sandwell only have Labour councillors and that has been the case for ages. Local democracy is failing and need urgent reforms.

attributes.action: Link all public sector salaries to MPs' salaries (Backdated to April 2014)
attributes.background: Since April 2014, MPs' salaries have increased by 10.3%, whereas most  working in the public sector have seen salary stagnation. The goal of this petition is to link the increase of public sector salaries with MPs' salaries both backdated to April 2014 and in the future.

attributes.action: Save West Cumberland Hospital
attributes.background: West Cumberland Hospital serves the West of the county of Cumbria. Assets are being stripped from the hospital in favour of "specialising" in a PFI hospital in Carlisle. If assets such as A&E, consultant led Midwifery and Paediatrics are removed we are in serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The nearest hospital is the PFI Cumberland Infirmary in Carlisle, some 40 miles from Whitehaven. Owing to the rural spread and coverage of WCH we need to keep it. Please see Jamie Reed MP for further details.

attributes.action: Park Home residents should have the legal right to install water sub-meters.
attributes.background: All homes on our park pay an equal amount.  There are single and double occupied homes.  Many residents spend weeks or months away from their homes for different reasons, holidays, hospital stays etc.  Water leakage from the one meter on the park to the homes is included in the total bill.

attributes.action: Manditory detainment for persons arrested on suspicion of terrorism - no bail
attributes.background: In light of the current severe threat of terrorism in the UK and throughout the world, any individual arrested on suspicion of terrorist offences should be denied bail pending enquiries, charges and trial as they pose a genuine flight risk thus putting lives of the general public at greater risk.

attributes.action: Exempt self employed subbies from Class 4 national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: From 2015, self employed people have to pay 9% national insurance on all profits over £8000 which brings your total yearly tax up to near a whopping 29% per year. Previously self employed people only had to pay a rate of £2.80 per week class 2 national insurance as they were not directly employed.

attributes.action: Replace the Human Rights Act with a UK Bill of Rights
attributes.background: We need to scrap the European Human Rights directives implementation in the UK and replace it with a UK Bill of Rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights which the British government helped create has become a joke and we have lost control of the UK's criminal system, unable to deport people who actively want to harm British citizens back to their home countries.

We need a bill of rights that protects the British people.

attributes.action: Ensure road cyclists pay a tax and adhere to a DVLA type set of rules
attributes.background:
Taxing cyclists who are over the age of 18 £30 a year would generate £130m+ per year which can be used for cycle lane projects and improving the roads.

With this tax, cyclists should also be made to followe a DVLA type set of rules when on the roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The tax would generate over £130m+ a year which could be used to improve roads for cyclalcists and help with cycle lane projects.

The DVLA type rules would also help reduce the amount of road accidents involving cyclists. Currently 48% of all cyclists feel unsafe when out on the roads. These new rules will help both cyclists and other road users make better choices when it comes to scenarios involving cyclists.

Do the right thing for Britain - sign this petition.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Government over it's Education policies.
attributes.background:
I would like a vote of no confidence in the Government's Education policies. There is now a crisis in teaching. Too many teachers are leaving the profession and the children and young people of our country are being let down by narrow minded Tories. 
They are failing children, parents and Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
Our children are being failed by the Tory government. 
Students are being forced to do the Ebacc and have their choices limited as a result of the narrowing of the curriculum.
Schools are being forced to be Academies which statistics prove are no better than when we had LEA schools. 
Schools need money to implement new changes and syllabuses yet are given no extra money. What's worse is that leaders of Academy Chains are paid ridiculous sums. Sir Daniel Moynihan takes over £13,000 per Academy!

attributes.action: Move the Westminster Government at least 100 miles further North, permanently.
attributes.background: Moving the seat of government out of the UK's richest enclave would make MPs think differently about all of the country.  It would put thousands of highly-paid supporting jobs where costs are lower and whose local economy would benefit from a boost, and impact London House prices favourably.
attributes.additional_details:
Presently even the leadership of the Northern Powerhouse is 97% in London (Guardian, 7/3/16).

The forthcoming, very costly refurbishment means the Westminster government will need at least a temporary home. Other worthy petitions call for it to be 'outside London'. This one calls for permanent relocation, a clear and 'pychological' distance to the North of London. The physical Houses of Parliament could be refurbished with a view to some other use.

attributes.action: Reinstate the state pension age to 65 for all and stop future age increases
attributes.background: When i started work we were told 65 was your retirement age now their moving this all the time with sucsessive reviews every few years this needs to stop now I like many others cannot retire without the state pension we need to make a stand

attributes.action: Make it illegal for insurance companies to penalise victims of crime
attributes.background:
As a victim of more than eight hit & run accidents against our motor vehicle in four years, of which five were reported to the police with no action other than receiving a crime number.

We have now been declined renewal on our motor insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
It is criminal that insurance companies can be allowed to impose punitive action against innocent victims of crime.

Our justice system and British values are built on innocent until proven guilty and punishing perpetrators of crime not the victims.

It is quite clear the Financial Conduct Authority is incapable of regulating the insurance industry and ensuring ethical behavior is enshrined into the financial sector and so we must pass laws to stop this diabolical behavior.

attributes.action: Prove that fining parents for kids' term time absence has reduced truancy rates
attributes.background: I have heard no evidence that fining parents for taking children out of school during term time has had any effect at all. In fact, Wales has opted out and I believe some schools' governing bodies are doing/have done likewise. I also believe the fine should go to the school and not the government.

attributes.action: Vote on freezing foreign aid handouts for the next 4 years
attributes.background: Whilst listening to BBC Stoke they were discussing the £1.2b that will be given as foreign aid over the next 4 years. They repeatedly described it as a drop in the ocean compared to the budget of the nhs of over £400b. It's not a drop in the ocean. It's our money and our tax and we should have a say
attributes.additional_details: I suggest a public vote of some kind on the matter, so the people of the UK can decide if £1.2b of our tax money is simply given away. Why not split it between police forces facing cuts or the fire service. This petition isn't to stop foreign aid. It's to allow the people of Britain to vote and have a say on the matter

attributes.action: Allow women to enter direct combat in the RAF.
attributes.background: The RAF does not allow women to enter direct combat. This is not consistent with the equality that women supposedly have today. This level of sexism should be eliminated from the armed services.

attributes.action: create a independent government oversight comittee
attributes.background:
This country needs a Non Bias, Independent Committee that all complaints about the PM and MPs can be sent to and investigated.

Be it Misconduct in public office, a breach of the PM ministerial code of practice or just a general complaint about the way they dealt with a constituent
attributes.additional_details:
Currently u contact PM for a breach of the ministerial code of practice or speak with the Parliamentary standards committee. currently who deals with what complaint the public don't really know.

A independent committee especially for breaches of the ministerial code of practice  and Misconduct in Public office would make it easier and fairer and give the public more trust that the investigations are being carried out fully with no bias and not being swept under the carpet

attributes.action: Introduce a tax on nonrecyclable packaging.
attributes.background: We're all familiar with the experience of having to discard packaging which the local waste disposal scheme cannot handle - for instance plastic tops for takeaway coffee. A tax should be introduced to tip the balance in favour of biodegradable or recyclable packaging.
attributes.additional_details: We have gradually improved matters as a nation. In 1990, Chris Patten, then Secretary of State for the Environment, aimed to have 25 per cent of domestic rubbish recycled or reused by the year 2000. Later, Lord Deben and Ken Clarke introduced the Landfill Tax as a result of the EU Waste Directive. Now the government has decreed that large shops in England will have to charge five pence for all single use plastic carrier bags. A tax on nonrecyclable packaging is the next logical step.

attributes.action: Petition the new New Prime mimister
attributes.background:
The British People demand that When the next Conservative Leader is elected They Sign a Statement of intent Has to when They will invoke Article 50 Before the end of 2016
To reasure the Business World stability And the British Nation
attributes.additional_details:
It is now important that the Goverment 
Stand and deliver on the democratic vote of this nation and come clean on there intentions No more dirty tricks lies and misleading information When will article 50 or Preferably article 72 be signed

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: The independent election of the director general of the BBC.
attributes.background: There are numerous cases recently where the journalistic integrity and neutrality of the British Broadcasting Corporation has come into question.  The neutrality of the BBC is essential in order for the British people to make informed decisions regarding Politics in the United Kingdom.
